content.title: Scheme Of Coaching & Allied For Scheduled Tribes
content.department: Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare
content.details: To promote a more level playing field, and give Scheduled Tribe (ST) candidates a better chance to succeed in competitive examinations, the Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare has launched a scheme for coaching and pre-examination training for disadvantaged SC candidates in quality coaching institutions to enable them to appear in competitive examinations and succeed in obtaining an appropriate job in the public/private sector.
benefits: Stipend of Rs.1000/- fixed per month for the entire period of coaching.
Financial assistance for boarding and lodging to outstation students @ Rs.2000/- per month per student.
eligibility: Should be a resident of Jharkhand.
Should belong to Scheduled Tribe (ST) category.
Should have the eligible qualifications for the mentioned competitive exams.
The income ceiling of candidates should not exceed ₹ 2,50,000/- per annum.
documents_required: Audited accounts for last three years
Results of last three years (with grading) vis-à-vis intake
Details of Faculty and their academic/professional qualification
Confirmation by concerned Deputy Commissioner regarding genuineness of institution
Surety Bond signed by the full Executive Committee
The undertaking by the institution to the effect that the institute has not received grant for the same purpose from any other Department.
Results in the prescribed format of the SC candidates given coaching under the scheme.

faqs.question: What is the main objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The main objective of the scheme is to provide coaching and pre-examination training for disadvantaged ST candidates in quality coaching institutions to enable them to appear in competitive examinations and succeed in obtaining an appropriate job in the public/private sector.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: This scheme has been launched by the Department of Scheduled Tribe, Scheduled Caste, Minority and Backward Class Welfare, Jharkhand.

faqs.question: Who will be covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Registered Private Coaching Institutions/ NGO’s running their centre in the State of Jharkhand shall be covered under the scheme.

faqs.question: Where the programs need to be conducted?
faqs.answer: Coaching Institutions/NGO’s selected under the scheme have to conduct the coaching program at Ranchi and Dumka.

faqs.question: Is there any income criteria for the ST candidates?
faqs.answer: The income ceiling of candidates under the scheme will be ₹ 2,50,000/- per annum.
